keyPolicies.policyTitle: Employment and Equality in the Workplace
keyPolicies.policyDescription: Fight for low paid workers and campaign for those earning less than £11k to be exempt from paying income tax. Tackle the issues of racism, discrimination, bullying and harassment in the workplace, encouraging those affected to speak out and forcing employers to deal with the perpetrators.
Deal with the root causes of this blight in society. Working with agencies to restore order on our streets and neighbourhoods for law abiding citizens.

issues.brexitEurope: laws, control its borders, and become a global trading nation by rekindling its relationship with the Commonwealth.
issues.economy: campaign for those earning less than £11k to be exempt from paying income tax.

leaflet.personalStatement: Born in Jamaica, I lived in Bradford, West Yorkshire from the age of 11, and gained a Master of Education Degree at the University of Leeds in 1994. I have taught in FE and HE institutions in the UK and at high schools in Jamaica; worked in broadcast media as a scriptwriter/presenter/producer; and managed my own film production company. I am keen for Britain to once again make its own laws, control its borders, and become a global trading nation by rekindling its relationship with the Commonwealth.

politicalExperience.achievements: Taught in further education and higher education institutions in the UK and high schools in Jamaica.
Worked as a scriptwriter, presenter, and producer.
Managed my own film production company.
